Method Detail

testPrintFloat2OnStream

public void testPrintFloat2OnStream()
This is different from the Smalltalk implementation. In Squeak, this produces: byte[] answer = { 62, 76, (byte) 204, (byte) 204 }; (i.e. answer= {62, 76, -52, -52}) The source of this discrepency is Squeak conversion routine Float>>asIEEE32BitWord vs. the Java Float::floatToIntBits(float). 0.2 asIEEE32BitWord yields: 1045220556 Float.floatToIntBits((float) 0.2) yields: (int) 1045220557 (VA Java 3.5) Looks like there is an OBO bug somwhere -- either Java or Squeak.
